main event: Sighting of an unidentified bright light with a reddish glow in the center and a white halo around the outer edge in Avon Park, Florida on October 26, 1957.
interesting points: The object was observed for several minutes, then went out of sight rapidly, 'faster than it went out of sight fast'.
The object was similar in size and shape to a jet aircraft on take-off or landing, but much larger.
The object hovered in one position for several minutes before rapidly going out of sight.
There were no thunder storms, precipitation, or known aircraft in the area at the time of the sighting.
The only discrepancy noted was that A/10 Barnett also saw the light.
sighted object: A bright light with a reddish glow in the center and a white halo around the outer edge
